entry.title: How to find specific rights for User Security using Query Builder?
entry.content:
I am attempting to build a utility that can assign the desired security across the SAP environment. Currently I am testing setting the user security for a User Group on a Universe and have set some of the rights, but one in particular is not working. So I am wondering what object is storing those rights so I can try to identify what went wrong and ig I maybe have an incorrect ID.

This was an old utility I am attempting to update.

GetUniverse() successfully queries to get the targeted universe and the rights are all being set as expected except UniverseDataAccessRight. I don't know what the IDs that are assigned to the consts represent, but using them as a SI_ID did not find anything on CI_SYSTEMOBJECTS, CI_APPOBJECTS, or CI_INFOOBJECTS . If someone could tell me where the rights exist I could probably work out why its not assigning like the others

 

EDIT: Actually I was wrong about UniverseCreateEditQueryRight applying correctly. It is using an inherited right, not the one being set by the code. So neither are being set as intended. So still need to know what I need to access.

 

private const int UniverseDataAccessRight = 17367047;
private const int UniverseDataConnectionAccessRight = 19857415;
private const int UniverseCreateEditQueryRight = 17367048;

private string UpdateUniverseSecurity(string universeName, out string universeCuid)
{
string actionText = string.Empty;

InfoObjects universes = GetUniverse(universeName, ref actionText);


if (universes.Count == 1)
{
universeCuid = universes[1].CUID;
actionText += $"Setting security on universe \"{universeName}\".";

var advisorUserGroupPrincipal = universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(AdvisorUsersGroup.ID);
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.AddSystemRight((int)CeSystemRights.ceRightView).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseDataAccessRight).Granted = true;
advisorUserGroupPrincipal.Rights.Add(UniverseCreateEditQueryRight).Granted = true;
universes[1].SecurityInfo.ObjectPrincipals.Add(EveryoneGroup.ID).Role = CeRole.ceRoleNoAccess;
IStore.Commit(universes);
}
else
universeCuid = string.Empty;

return actionText;
}

entry.title: DRTM Master Data Purge error: "There is no country specified for this user or user's country..."
entry.content:
The DRTM Master Data Purge requires prerequisites and configuration for a user to be successfully purged.

After you proceed with a DRTM Master Data Purge when you go to see the result, sometimes you see that the Purge is completed but you have the error "There is no country specified for this user or user's country is not DRM enabled.", meaning that the user was not purged and there is some misconfiguration.

And then you are wondering: what specifically is causing this error? How to verify this and correct for the Purge to be completed successfully? Is the Country missing? Is the Company Exit Date / Termination date missing? How to self-check and fix this for the Purge to be completed successfully?

Thinking about you and this scenario, we have developed the Troubleshooting DRTM Master Data Purge error: There is no country specified for this user or user's ... Guided Answers.

These Guided Answers were created with a step-by-step instructions and self-service troubleshooting to help you navigate the process and resolve the error on your own. These Guided Answers were inspired and created based on the methods that Product Support Team troubleshoot issues related to this error.

We hope you use it and your feedback is welcome for us to improve these Guided Answers further.

entry.title: Closing the Value Gap: Maximizing Share of Wallet and Reducing Contract Leakage
entry.content:
Share of wallet  

Share of wallet is the dollar amount a customer devotes to a particular supplier in a product category.  Suppliers try to maximize an existing customer's share of wallet by introducing multiple products and services to generate as much revenue as possible from each customer. A marketing campaign, for example, may have a stated goal of increasing the supplier‚Äôs wallet share for specific customers at the expense of its competitors. 

Benefits from increasing a customer‚Äôs share of wallet include added revenue, improved client retention, customer satisfaction and brand loyalty. 

Share of Wallet vs. Market Share 

Increasing wallet share can be a less expensive, more efficient, and therefore a more profitable strategy for suppliers to boost revenue rather than attempting to expand overall market share. It's important to note that wallet share and market share are two different concepts. Both market share and wallet share focus on growing revenue from customers. However, the growing market share focuses on attracting new clients from the competition. On the other hand, share of wallet focuses on growing revenue from existing clients by expanding the number of products being used‚Äìwhich might also be taken from the competition. 

Contract Value 

Contract value is the monetary value of a contract. It can range anywhere from a few hundred to millions of dollars. All of this depends on the work that is carried out or the products that are requested. Contract value also depends on the size of the customer that issues the initial proposal. A bid from an SME can be expected to have a lower contract value than a bid issued by a large enterprise trading on the SAP Business Network 

Contract Leakage 

Suppliers loose hundreds of thousands to millions of dollars through what is called contract leakage ‚Äî the difference between the expected contract value and the real value created in production. That difference can be enormous. According to the International Association for Contract & Commercial Management (IACCM), poor contract management costs companies up to 9% of their revenue.   

Depending on the supplier‚Äôs industry, customers may not commit to a specific contract value or annual turnover. When this occurs, suppliers focus on educating buyers about their actual spend and encouraging them to channel more spend through their e-procurement channels. Suppliers may offer incentives for reaching certain volume thresholds such and reduced handling charges.  

Problems 

Contract leakage is a problem for both buyers and suppliers including the following issues:

Suppliers  

  • Lost Opportunities/Revenue: Suppliers fail to capitalize on opportunities for existing work, additional work, extensions, or renewals.  
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, marketing, promotions, unnecessary or obsolete inventory  

Buyers 

  • Cost Overruns: If leakage exceeds contracted value, the buyer may be ineligibles for negotiated price discounts or rebates. 
  • Missed goals: The buyer‚Äôs goals to consolidate spend, reduce supplier base, address compliance and process needs not met. 
  • Cost Overruns: Poor return on investment in such areas as catalogue integration, transactional integration, sourcing effort, contracting effort‚Ä¶. 

Buyers and suppliers 

  • Relationship Strain: Leakage can result in contractual disputes and strain relationships between parties, affecting collaboration, and potentially leading to contract/relationship terminations and increased costs. 

Typical Causes 

Contract leakage may be the result of any of the following root causes:

  • Lack of visibility: Lack of visibility into all spend data, making it difficult to track and manage all transactions.  Buyers may not understand the full range of a supplier‚Äôs capabilities. 
  • Lack of commitment: Buyers not committing to a contract value or annual turnover can lead to untracked spend and leakage. 
  • Ineffective Rollout Plans:‚ÄØPoorly executed rollout plans can lead to low adoption and confidence issues among users. 
  • Data Quality Issues:‚ÄØInadequate or incomplete data in catalogs can affect search results and product visibility, leading to leakage. 
  • Lack of Enforcement:‚ÄØBuyers not enforcing the adoption of new systems or allowing multiple supplier choices can result in continued use of previous vendors.  Customers using multiple purchasing channels, such as direct websites, instead of a single integrated platform.‚ÄØUsers deviating from the established procurement process and preferred suppliers.‚ÄØ  
  • System Integration Problems:‚ÄØTechnical issues during system integration can cause disruptions and affect order processing. 
  • External Factors:‚ÄØChanges in customer business models, economic conditions, or other external factors can impact demand and lead to leakage. 

These factors highlight the complexity of addressing contract leakage and the need for thorough analysis and collaboration between suppliers and buyers. 

Typical Remedies 

By implementing these strategies, buyers and suppliers can reduce leakage, improve contract compliance, and enhance overall performance:

  • Regular Business Reviews:‚ÄØConduct regular business reviews with sales sponsors and buy-side sponsors to compare contract promises with actual performance and identify areas for improvement. 
  • Improve Data Quality:‚ÄØEnsure robust and accurate catalog data to enhance search results and product visibility, making it easier for users to find and order products. 
  • Adoption Monitoring:‚ÄØImplement a dedicated team to perform regular health checks with customers, addressing adoption issues and improving system usage. 
  • Collaborative Target Setting:‚ÄØWork with buyers to set collaborative spend targets and monitor progress, addressing any discrepancies proactively. 
  • Benchmarking and Analysis:‚ÄØBenchmark performance against other channels and systems to identify best practices and areas for improvement.  
  • Supplier lists: Sharing suppliers lists with buyers may to help buyers consolidate their spend and improve transparency. Supplier lists may helps buyers achieve better volume bundling, leverage process efficiencies, and ultimately reduce costs. Sharing these lists also facilitates better collaboration and trust with buyers. 
  • Customer Feedback:‚ÄØGather anecdotal evidence and feedback from sales reps and customers to understand specific issues and develop targeted solutions. 
  • System Integration Support:‚ÄØProvide strong support during system integration to ensure smooth implementation and address any technical issues promptly. 
  • Educating Buyers: Informing customers about the full extent of their spend in specific categories and encouraging them to channel more of their spend through the supplier's platform. 
  • Offering Incentives: Providing incentives for buyers to reach certain volume thresholds. 
  • Blocking Non-Preferred Suppliers: Asking buyers to block certain suppliers in their system to ensure all relevant spend goes through the preferred supplier 

Conclusion

Maximizing share of wallet and minimizing contract leakage are both critical to realizing the full value of buyer‚Äìsupplier relationships. While expanding market share attracts new customers, increasing wallet share and strengthening contract compliance help suppliers unlock greater revenue potential from existing partnerships. Effective contract management, robust data quality, and transparent collaboration are essential to closing the gap between expected and realized contract value.

entry.title: Re: Combining MATID and MATNR field in CDS/AMDP
entry.content:
When joining the "MARA" table with "/SCWM/AQUA", you should link the SCWM-"MATID" with the MARA-"SCM_MATID_GUID16" ...
I believe this should not involve a conversion on your part ...

Something like below sample code should work :

define view ZTMP_TESTCDS
  as select from mara
    join /scwm/aqua on mara.scm_matid_guid16 = /scwm/aqua.matid
{
  mara.matnr       as Material,
  /scwm/aqua.matid as Material_Guid,
  mara.mtart       as MaterialType
}

Hope this helps

Nic T.

entry.title: Principal Propagation failing between BTP Mobile Services, Cloud Connector and S/4 HANA - Access Den
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm experiencing an issue with Principal Propagation when connecting SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) application through BTP Mobile Services to an on-premise S/4 HANA system via Cloud Connector.

Current Setup:

  • Source: SAP Mobile Services (BTP)
  • Middleware: SAP Cloud Connector
  • Target: SAP S/4 HANA on-premise (Client 400)

Problem Description:

When I configure the connection in Mobile Services to use "Cloud Connector SSO" as the SSO mechanism and try to test it using the "Launch in Browser" button, I receive the following error:

 
Access denied to system molinos.rise:8000. In case this was a valid request, ensure to expose the system correctly in your cloud connector.

However, the same OData service works perfectly when:

  1. Accessed directly from the S/4 HANA system browser
  2. Using a BTP Destination with Basic Authentication (username/password)

But it fails when using Principal Propagation authentication method.

Current Configuration:

Cloud Connector:

  • Principal Type: X.509 Certificate
  • Resources: / exposed with "Path And All Sub-Paths"

Connection to S/4 HANA: ‚úÖ Active

What I've Already Checked:

‚úÖ Cloud Connector can reach S/4 HANA system (green status) ‚úÖ OData service is active in SICF ‚úÖ Resource "/" is exposed in Cloud Connector ‚úÖ Virtual-to-internal host mapping is correct ‚úÖ Basic Authentication works (confirms the OData service itself is working) ‚úÖ Cloud Connector certificate appears to be in STRUST

Questions:

  • Is there any additional trust configuration needed between BTP, Cloud Connector, and S/4 HANA for X.509 certificate-based SSO?
  • Are there any specific authorizations my user needs in S/4 HANA to consume OData services via Principal Propagation? (Besides the standard OData consumption authorizations)

How can I verify that the Cloud Connector is correctly sending the certificate/user information to S/4 HANA?

Logs/Additional Info:

The error appears immediately when clicking "Launch in Browser" in Mobile Services. The Cloud Connector audit log shows the request is being blocked at the Cloud Connector level with the "Access denied" message.

Any guidance on the correct configuration steps or troubleshooting approach would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: BAdI to change PMP0 value of PO Item
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun,

You cannot modify PMP0 through MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM because this BAdI does not influence pricing.
If you need to set or override the Manual Gross Price (PMP0) in a purchase order, use the relevant pricing BAdIs instead.

PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT overrides the amount for a specific condition at the item level, filtering by Condition Type = 'PMP0'.

MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR influences the price determination for PO items, like identifying which condition contributes.

Implement both in Custom Fields and Logic key-user extensibility. Make sure PMP0 is included in your purchasing schema and that it is allowed for manual or logic updates; otherwise, the BAdI will not work.

Useful SAP Documentation

SAP KBA 3580006 ‚Äì Purchase Order Price Enhancement ,explains using PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT and MM_PUR_S4_PO_DEFINE_CNDNCTR. SAP Support Portal-3580006 - Purchase Order Price Enhancement in SAP S/HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP KBA 2756560 ‚Äì Cloud BAdIs for Pricing Lists available pricing BAdIs and usage through Custom Fields and Logic. SAP Support Portal-2756560 - Cloud BAdIs for pricing

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Creating a segregation role for reporting not working correctly
entry.content:
Hi,

We need to segregate the information in a specific RCM report, where some users in the company should only be able to view data by their Org Unit or Department (depending on their position). These same users also need access to Performance module reports.

Additionally, they can create requisitions in the RCM module, but the company‚Äôs restriction is that they can only create requisitions for positions where the field Position Vacant = Yes.

When we create the Granted and Target Groups for them in RCM, it works perfectly within RCM Reports. However, this setup impacts the Performance reports, as they can only see a limited number of employees ‚Äî those whose positions have the field Position Vacant = Yes.

Is there any way to segregate all SuccessFactors data (RCM, Performance, Onboarding, Employee Central, etc.) by Org Unit or Department (depending on the position), while at the same time ensuring that these users can only create requisitions in RCM where Position Vacant = Yes?

Thanks,

Juan

entry.title: SAPUI5 Date Input and UTC Conversion
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I‚Äôm currently working as a SAPUI5 developer, and I wanted to open up a discussion (and hopefully learn from you all) about a challenge I keep running into:
DATE HANDLING in UI5/Fiori apps.
Whenever I encounter date fields ‚Äî whether it's in forms, tables, filters, or while sending/receiving dates via OData ‚Äî I get a bit anxious üòÖ. It's not like I haven't dealt with it before, but there always seems to be some unexpected issue:
  • Timezone differences
  • Formatting inconsistencies (backend vs frontend)
  • OData model quirks (Edm.Date vs Edm.DateTimeOffset)
  • Date pickers showing wrong values
  • Converting to UTC and back again

Scenario 1 - Reading Date from Date Picker ==> Whenever user selects any date from date picker, I want to get the UTC date.

For example - I am working in IST time zone and if I select the date 17-Oct-2025 in date picker and when I read it in my change event handler I get the date as 17-Oct-2025 based on local time zone. But when I tried to get the UTC date, it will be 16-Oct-2025. 

My expectation is when user selects 17-Oct-2025 irrespective of  local time zone, model property(VALID_TO) will be set to UTC date '17-08-2025T00:00:00Z'. I am doing something like this to achieve this.

Date Picker Code in UI view - 

 

<DatePicker value="{path:'localModel>VALID_TO',type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', constraints: { displayFormat: 'Date' }, formatOptions: {pattern: 'yyyy-MM-dd',  strictParsing: true, UTC: true }}" change="handleDateChange"  />
 

Date Change Event Handler - HandleDateChange in Controller

handleDateChange: function (oEvent) {
        var source = oEvent.getSource(),
          oTable = source.getParent(),          
          contextRow = oTable.getBindingContext("LocalModel").getPath() + "/VALID_TO",
          inputValue = source.getDateValue();
          //Get the Local Date Converted to UTC
          let utcDate = new Date(Date.UTC(inputValue.getFullYear(),inputValue.getMonth(),inputValue.getDate()));
          console.log(utcDate);
          this.getModel('LocalModel').setProperty(contextRow, utcDate);
      }
 This is working as expected. Your thoughts on this and if there is better way of doing it.
 
Scenario 2 - Using formatter to convert date object to UTC
Formatter Code - Check if date is defined and is a Date Object then format it as per UTC. I want to know if this is correct or there is other way of doing it. Also are there any other conditions which I should add apart from checking date instance. Or this will work in all scenarios.
Scenario 3 - Checking if input/parameter passed is Valid Date Object- Anything else we need to check or some other way of checking it.
Code - 
checkDateObject: function (date) {
      return date instanceof Date && !isNaN(date.getTime());
    }

I would like to hear your thoughts on the common date scenarios mentioned above. Additionally, please inform me whether the code provided above is useful or not.

Thanks,

Dhiraj More

entry.title: Re: Supplier Rating App in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Amit66 

You can use the standard Supplier Evaluation apps in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for your scenario involving delivery schedules, shortages, and product quality; there's no need for a customised app.

Core evaluation apps (Version 2)

Supplier Evaluation by Time (F1664A) , evaluates delivery schedule adherence. (Based on the delivery and Goods Receipt Date)

Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (F1661A) , measures shortages and over or under-deliveries.

 

Supplier Evaluation by Quality (F3295A) , uses quality notifications and inspection results to score product quality.

 

 

Configuration and scoring documentation

  • Supplier Evaluation Weighting and Scoring (F2551). Define and assign importance to your KPIs (Time, Quantity, Quality) for an overall supplier score..
  • Manage User Defined Criteria for Supplier (F3812), optional; allows you to add your own evaluation dimensions.
  • Operational Supplier Evaluation (F1662A), view overall scores and explore detailed results.

These Apps are in the Purchasing Analytics and Supplier Management catalogues.

More useful SAP documentation

  • SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Supplier Evaluation and Scoring in Procurement
  • SAP Fiori Apps Library ‚Äì Supplier Evaluation by Quantity (Version 2)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Exchange Rate Difference Line with Zero Amount Preven...
entry.content:
Hello @kaya-ya 

Thank you for the clarification and for sharing the screenshots.

This is expected system behaviour. Although your business transactions are in TWD, the system must ensure each document is balanced across all active currencies, including the group currency (USD). When a down payment and an invoice are settled together, SAP automatically records a realised exchange rate difference if their posting or exchange-rate dates differ even slightly.

The small 0.01 USD figure you noticed is not an error; it comes from rounding and item-level currency translation rather than the down-payment scenario. This effect can also occur with partial payments, credit memos, or any multi-line clearing when exchange rates fluctuate.

You don‚Äôt need to delete this line. Instead, make sure that your exchange-rate difference accounts are correctly maintained. Define Accounts for Exchange Rate Differences and ensure that both the down payment and invoice use the appropriate rate type and posting date.

Useful SAP Documentation

  • SAP KBA 2539550; More gain/loss lines generated with amount 0.00 in LC1 or LC2 when clearing
  • SAP Help Portal; Managing Exchange Rate Differences
  • SAP Fiori App; Automatic Account Determination

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Issue While posting Idoc in SAP ECC- SAP BTP-CI
entry.content:
Hmm, "Response was of unexpected text/html ContentType." -- Can it be that CI is posting the XML IDoc with a wrong Content-Type? One tip would be to compare the iFlow in DEV-CI and in QA-CI, whether there is any difference in the settings for the HTTP POST operation, especially the HTTP Header field "Content-Type", which I think the ALE layer in the SAP system expects as "text/xml".

(Which by the way is kind of strange, because around 1998, when the SAP IDoc-XML format was defined, we introduced a special HTTP Content-Type for it: application/x-sap.idoc
The SAP Business Connector still uses application/x-sap.idoc today, when receiving and sending IDoc-XML messages, which is very convenient, because general text/xml messages are only sent through the standard XML-parser, while messages received with the special application/x-sap.idoc Content-Type are automatically converted into Java IDoc objects, which can then be processed directly in the graphical mapping tool or using the "SAP JCo IDoc Libary". But that is "off-topic"...)

Another possibility is: the SAP system sends an HTML page in case of error (for example: user and password are wrong). In that case the HTTP client (which is CI in this case) receives an HTML page ("text/html") with further error details. In that case you would only need to read that HTML page (= the body of the HTTP response) and then you know what the SAP system is complaining about...! But I don't know if and how the CI system allows to log/trace the response body of failed HTTP requests?! (In the Business Connector, there is a switch that turns on HTTP trace, logging the complete request & response (all headers and the body), which is quite nice for trouble-shooting.)

entry.title: Re: Purchase SA for Advance intercompany STO
entry.content:
Hi @Angelasapphire 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you are right. As of the current public cloud edition, the STO process does not support purchase scheduling agreements.

What is supported as of today is the Advanced Intercompany STO, which covers Sales/Purchasing orgs in different companies with Purchase Orders but not scheduling agreements.

Although purchase scheduling agreements are available in public cloud for standard procurement, the same functionality is not yet integrated into the Advanced Intercompany STO process.

At this time SAP is yet to publish any roadmap item or feature note that confirms when or whether this integration will be delivered in future releases.

You may consider raising this on the SAP influence page if this is critical to your busines/project.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Procurement via Service Order initiated by Solution O...
entry.content:
Hi @Sorosch_Sakhiza 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manage Solution Orders, Service Contract Management & Expanded Use of NORM Item Category for Sales Items for more details.

In summary, be aware that when spare parts are added to a solution order that already includes a service contract, the system creates a service order to handle procurement and service execution.

After the service entry sheet is posted, what happens next depend on your configuration:

  • If the service order item is billable, a billing document request is created and invoiced through solution order billing control.
  • If it is non-billable, no billing document will be created. That means your costs will remain internal.

You do have the option to control this behaviour through the item category setup in your solution order template.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Workzone Advanced - My Workspace template
entry.content:
Hi @wkpk! Hope you are keeping well.

According to About My Workspace | SAP Help Portal "My Workspace" is a personal workspace. If the feature is enabled, all users see the same default My Workspace and can modify it to suit their personal requirements with all enabled cards and widgets in the system.

All users can create their own workspace. However, there are some limitations as to what you can use it for and what you can add to it.

  • Only you can see your My Workspace. You can't share it with others or add members to it.

  • You can add documents, apps, and information that you use on a daily basis but you can't share the content with your colleagues or teams using feeds.

  • Some widgets can't be added to My Workspace - for example, Forums or Events.

    This is also reinforced in KBA 3666301 - Is it possible to change the My Workspace default image for all users at once in SAP Build Work Zone Advanced? - SAP for Me which outlines that system currently does not support setting a custom default image for My Workspace at the global or administrative level.
    Users can manually update or replace this image after accessing their workspace, but administrators cannot predefine or push a different image to all users through configuration, theme management, or the Administration Console.

    Should you wish to see this behavior changed, please provide feedback to the Product Management team via the Influence Page where other customers will also have the opportunity to support your functionality request. Please raise an Enhancement request.

    To submit enhancement requests for Work Zone, you can follow the steps below:

    1. Go to the SAP Customer Influence site, log on with your S-user and accept the terms of use.
    2. Depending on which Work Zone edition you use, navigate to:
       SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone Influence Opportunity Homepage
       SAP Build Work Zone Influence Opportunity Homepage
    3. Open "All Requests" and search if your idea has already been submitted by another customer. If not, use the "Submit Improvement" button to create a new idea and fill in the relevant template.
    4. Take the opportunity to vote for ideas that you wish to support and plan to take advantage of in your organization. You will be notified on updates regarding ideas you have voted for.

    Note: On the Customer Influence Homepage, you will find information on how to submit and manage improvement requests.

entry.title: Re: How to fix if IBAN appears in Altern. Bank Acc. in in...
entry.content:
Hello @rekafulop 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Bank Statement Processing, J58 Accounting and Financial close & App Extensibility: Manage Bank Accounts for some details.

To summarise, yes may get that error about the IBAN for the account not fitting on Altern when you process an MT940 file in Incoming Payment Files. That occurs because the system matches the IBAN in the bank statement to IBAN field in the house bank master. If it is stored in the Alternate Account field instead, the system cannot recognise it. You can fix this as follows:

  • Go to Manage Bank Accounts --> Open your House Bank Account

  • Then remove the IBAN from the Alternate Bank Account No. Field.
  • Ensure the correct IBAN is only in the IBAN field.
  • Save and reimport the MT940 file.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: A Developer‚Äôs Guide to Building Hybrid Transactional Fiori Apps with RAP and Embedded Analytics
entry.content:
In many SAP S/4HANA implementations, particularly those involving Fiori List Reports, business users often require a unified experience that combines transactional capabilities ,such as executing actions on records ,with analytical insights like grouping, subtotals, and totals. This is especially relevant in operational reporting scenarios where decisions are made directly from the data view.
These hybrid use cases are common in operational reporting, where users need to analyze data and take immediate action within the same interface.

However, when using analytical CDS views (annotated with @analytics.query: true), SAP RAP imposes architectural constraints that prevent the direct definition of actions within the same view. This limitation can be a bottleneck when designing intelligent, user-centric applications.

To overcome this challenge, the following approach is recommended:

 

  • Separate OData Services for Analytics and Transactions

    • Analytical Service: Built using a CDS view with @analytics.query: true, enabling features like grouping, subtotals, and totals.
    • Transactional Service: Developed using RAP with behavior definitions to support actions, determinations, and validations. This view excludes analytical annotations to maintain RAP compatibility.

  • UI5 Extension Logic for Action Integration

    • Use SAPUI5 extensions to wire up action buttons in the Fiori List Report.
    • These buttons trigger transactional logic from the RAP-based service, even though the data is displayed via the analytical service.

  • Workaround for Filtering on Aggregated Fields

    • Since analytical views often aggregate fields (e.g., total amounts), filtering directly on these fields may not work as expected.
    • Introduce dummy fields or helper logic to enable meaningful filtering in the UI.

This approach allows developers to deliver intelligent Fiori applications that combine the best of both worlds: real-time analytical insights and direct transactional capabilities. It supports business scenarios such as:

  • Mass approvals with KPI-based filtering
  • Sales performance analysis with direct follow-up actions
  • Inventory grouping with replenishment triggers

By decoupling analytics and actions at the service level and integrating them at the UI layer, you can build scalable, maintainable, and user-friendly applications that align with SAP‚Äôs clean core principles.

 

  • Analytical CDS View (OData V2 or V4)

You‚Äôve correctly defined analytical views such as:

  • Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL: Aggregates planned costs using sum(bpja.wtjhr)
  • Z_I_APPRREQ_COSTS: Joins totals with individual cost records
  • Z_I_APPROPRIATEREQUEST: Combines investment request data with ledger and object info
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Ledger Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Z_I_APPRREQ_LEDGER as select from tka01
inner join tbp0l on tbp0l.waers = tka01.waers
and tbp0l.periv = tka01.lmona
{

key tka01.kokrs as Kokrs,
tbp0l.periv as Periv,
tbp0l.waers as Waers,
tbp0l.lednr as Lednr

}
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Costs Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity Z_I_APPRREQ_COSTS
as select from bpja
inner join Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL on Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.Ledger = bpja.lednr
and Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.ObjectNumber = bpja.objnr

{


key bpja.lednr as Ledger,
key bpja.objnr as ObjectNumber,
key bpja.gjahr as FiscalYear,
// @semantics.currencycode
bpja.twaer as Currency,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'Currency'
bpja.wtjhr as PlancostsYear,
Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.Currency as Currency_Code,
@Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'Currency_Code'
Z_I_APPRREQ_TOTAL.PlancostsYear as PlancostsTotal
}

where
bpja.wrttp = '40';
@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Appropriate Request Costs Details.'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
serviceQuality: #X,
sizeCategory: #S,
dataClass: #MIXED
}

where bpja.wrttp = '40'
group by lednr,objnr,bpja.twaer;

Once done create a Service Behaviour and Definition for the above CDS Entity .

  • CDS entity with Action Service
    RAP-Based CDS View with Behavior Definition with Action
managed implementation in class zbp_appr_appremail unique;
strict ( 1 );

define behavior for ZAPPR_APPREMAIL //alias <alias_name>
persistent table ZAPPR_APPREMAIL
lock master
authorization master ( instance )

{
action Email parameter Z_APPROVER3 result [1] $self;
}

Abstract entity for the comments

@EndUserText.label: 'Approval 3 Input Details'
define abstract entity Z_APPROVER3
// with parameters parameter_name : parameter_type
{
comments : char255;

}

Behavior Definition code:

CLASS lhc_zappr_appremail DEFINITION INHERITING FROM cl_abap_behavior_handler.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
    METHODS get_instance_authorizations FOR INSTANCE AUTHORIZATION
      IMPORTING keys REQUEST requested_authorizations FOR zappr_appremail RESULT result.
    METHODS email FOR MODIFY
      IMPORTING keys FOR ACTION zappr_appremail~email RESULT result.
ENDCLASS.

CLASS lhc_zappr_appremail IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD get_instance_authorizations.
  ENDMETHOD.
  METHOD email.
 READ ENTITIES OF zappr_appremail IN LOCAL MODE
  ENTITY zappr_appremail
    FIELDS ( appr_request )
  WITH CORRESPONDING #( keys )
  RESULT DATA(lt_app_data).
    DATA: lv_recipient TYPE adr6-smtp_addr.
    DATA: lv_subject TYPE string.
    DATA: lv_content TYPE string.
    DATA : email_template_name TYPE smtg_tmpl_id VALUE 'ZEMAIL_APPROVAL'.
    DATA(email_api) =
  cl_smtg_email_api=>get_instance(
          iv_template_id = email_template_name  ).
    DATA(lv_html_text) = VALUE string( ).

    DATA(i_cds_key) = VALUE if_smtg_email_template=>ty_gt_data_key( ).
  " Get the RawHTML Content and Replace the palceholder with the INV Details in the email
    email_api->render( EXPORTING
                                iv_language = sy-langu
                                  it_data_key =  i_cds_key
                              IMPORTING
                                ev_subject = DATA(lv_subject_tmp)
                                ev_body_html = DATA(lv_body_html) ).

    LOOP AT keys INTO DATA(appdetails) .
   lv_content = |{ appdetails-%param-comments }|.
    exit.
  endloop.

REPLACE 'ZCOMMENTS' WITH lv_content INTO lv_body_html.
lv_subject = lv_subject_tmp.
 DATA(lv_body_html_soli) = cl_bcs_convert=>string_to_soli( lv_body_html ).  " Build HTML for Sending
    DATA(lo_multipart_ref) = NEW cl_gbt_multirelated_service( ).
    lo_multipart_ref->set_main_html(
        EXPORTING
          content     = lv_body_html_soli
          description = '' ).


TRY.

DATA(o_document) = cl_document_bcs=>create_document( i_type    = 'HTM'
 i_text    = lv_body_html_soli
 i_subject = CONV so_obj_des( lv_subject ) ).
* Sendrequest erzeugen
        DATA(o_send_request) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).
* Email-Subject festlegen, ip_subject ist vom Typ String
        o_send_request->set_message_subject( ip_subject = lv_subject ).
* Die Mail an den Sendrequest h√§ngen
        o_send_request->set_document( o_document ).
        o_send_request->set_sender( o_sender ).
        DATA o_recipient TYPE REF TO cl_cam_address_bcs .
        LOOP AT recipients ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_email_recipient>).
          o_send_request->add_recipient( i_recipient  = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( <fs_email_recipient>-email ) i_express = abap_true ).
        ENDLOOP.
* Sofort senden
        o_send_request->set_send_immediately( abap_true ).
* Dokument senden
        IF o_send_request->send( i_with_error_screen = abap_true ) = abap_true.
        ELSE.
        ENDIF.
      CATCH cx_root INTO DATA(e_text).
    ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

Now genrate the Service definition and service 

Create the Fiori List Report App

In SAP Business Application Studio:

    • Create a new project from template 
    • Select List Report Object Page  with analytical table and select the Odata entity generated from the aggregated Service
    • In the Manifest.json add additional Odata Service or use guided development  

 

 

 

 

 

 

Using the guided development  add a action as shwon below .

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns:core='sap.ui.core'
    xmlns='sap.m'>

 <Dialog class="sapUiSizeCompact"
        xmlns="sap.m"
        xmlns:ca="sap.ca.ui"
        xmlns:layout="sap.ui.layout"
        xmlns:form="sap.ui.layout.form"
        xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
        xmlns:unified="sap.ui.unified" title="{i18n>remarks}" contentWidth="200px" id="idremarks">
        <content >
            <form:SimpleForm columnsL="1" columnsM="1" maxContainerCols="1" layout="ResponsiveGridLayout" id="formexlstat" editable="true">
                <form:content >
                    <Label id="remarkslabel" text="{i18n>remarks}"/>
                    <Input id="idremarksinput" type="Text"/>
                </form:content>
            </form:SimpleForm>
        </content>
        <beginButton >
            <Button text="{i18n>idEmail}" press="._onSend" id="idEmail"/>
        </beginButton>
        <endButton>

        </endButton>
    </Dialog>
</core:FragmentDefinition>

Handle the action using the below controller code

sap.ui.define([
    "sap/m/MessageToast"
], function(MessageToast) {
    'use strict';
    return {
        onInit: function(){
           this.loadDialogFragment();
            this.AnalyticalTable = this.getView().byId('apprsendemail::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::apprListEmail--analyticalTable') 
            //this.getView(this.getView().getContent()[0].getContent().getItems()[0].getId())
        },
            _onCancel: function(oEvent){
        
            var oModel = this.getView().getModel();
            this._oDialog.close();
            if (this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog.destroy();
                this._oDialog = null; // Important to nullify the reference
            }
          
          
               
        },
        _onSend: function (oEvent) {
            //var oInput = this.byId("inputParam");
           // var sValue = oInput.getValue();
        
            // Get selected items from the Analytical List Table
            var oTable = this.getView().byId("apprsendemail::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::apprListEmail--analyticalTable"); // Replace with your table ID
            var aSelectedIndices = oTable._getSelectionPlugin().getSelectedIndices();
            var aSelectedItems = [];
        
            aSelectedIndices.forEach(function (iIndex) {
                var oContext = oTable.getContextByIndex(iIndex);
                aSelectedItems.push(oContext.getObject());
            });
        
            // Call the backend action with the selected items and parameter
            this._callBackendAction(aSelectedItems);
            oTable.getModel().refresh(true);
            // Close the dialog
            this._oDialog.close();
            if (this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog.destroy();
                this._oDialog = null; // Important to nullify the reference
            }
        },
        sendEmailList: function(oEvent) {
 //            MessageToast.show("Custom handler invoked.");
            if (!this._oDialog) {
                this._oDialog = sap.ui.xmlfragment("apprsendemail.ext.fragment.EmailListDialog", this);
                this.getView().addDependent(this._oDialog);
            }
            this._oDialog.open();
        },
        loadDialogFragment: function(){
            if (!this.ReleaseListDialog) {
                this.oDialog = this.loadFragment({
                    name: "apprsendemail.ext.fragment.EmailListDialog",
                    controller: this
                });
            }
        },
        _callBackendAction:  async function (aSelectedItems) {
            var oModel = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("emailAction");

            var sPath = "/Email"; // Adjust the path as needed
            var mParameters = {
                batchGroupId: "myChangeset",
                changeSetId: "myChangeset"
            };
           
            var comments =     sap.ui.getCore().byId("idremarksinput").getValue();
            // Example of calling the backend for each selected item
            aSelectedItems.forEach(function (oItem) {
                oModel.callFunction(sPath, {
                    method: "POST",
                    mParameters: mParameters,
                    urlParameters: {
                        "Appr_Request": oItem.Appr_Request,
                        "comments" : comments,
                    },
                  
                });
            });
            //Submitting the function import batch call
oModel.submitChanges({
	batchGroupId: "myChangeset", //Same as the batch group id used previously

    success: function (oData) {
  
//      var  oTable = this.getView().byId("releaseapprreq::sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ListReport.view.ListReport::appropriatelist--analyticalTable");
 //       oTable._getSelectionPlugin().getModel().refresh(true);
        // Handle success
        MessageToast.show("E-Mail erfolgreich gesendet");
    }.bind(this),
    error: function (oError) {
        // Handle error
        MessageToast.show("E-Mail wurde nicht erfolgreich gesendet");
    }

});
        },
        
    };
});

Once done deploy the app and this will be available in the Workzone and you see the app showing totals and also actions as shown below :

The approach outlined in this guide demonstrates how to:

  • Leverage CDS view annotations for grouping, subtotals, and totals
  • Integrate status tracking and multilingual support
  • Enable transactional actions like sending approval emails via RAP behavior
  • Maintain a clean architecture by decoupling analytics and actions at the service level and integrating them at the UI layer

This design not only enhances user productivity but also aligns with SAP‚Äôs clean core principles, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and future readiness of your S/4HANA applications.

entry.title: Re: Error message F110 : payment not possible because of...
entry.content:
Hello @oumouKD 

Your log only displays the generic F110 stop; the real blocker remains hidden until you enable the detailed proposal log.

Perform this task in Public Cloud with Fiori Manage set to Automatic Payments:

  • Open your run, then go to Parameters, and check the boxes for Line items, Payment method selection, and Due date and cash discount.
  • Re-run the Proposal, then open it to review Exceptions and Items to identify item-level errors such as Payment method not permitted, No house bank found, Partner bank type required, or Payment block.

Fix according to the message:

  • Payment method in company code (App Manage Payment Methods in Company Code),
  • Bank determination/house bank in the run,
  • Vendor bank/partner bank type/IBAN, or Remove payment block / ensure item is due.

Useful SAP documentation

SAP KBA 2858351 - How to check logs in the App Manage Automatic Payments

SAP Help ‚Äì How to analyse payment proposal errors in F110 (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).

In S4 Public Cloud, you must use the Manage Automatic Payments (F110) Fiori app and its Detailed Log / Exception views (not SE38). The general steps in the guide, checking parameters, and viewing logs, remain conceptually valid, but the navigation and tools differ in the Public Cloud

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: CDS View for Tax Date
entry.content:
Good day @maugustin 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Date Determination in Finance, Creating Custom CDS Views & Custom CDS Views for more insights.

In summary, there is currently no standard report for CDS view that shows the Tax Date or Tax Rate directly when you make use of the Tax Determination by Tax Date in public cloud. You can workaround this by:

  • Building a Custom CDS View on I_TaxJournalEntryItemCube or I_JournalEntryItemCube and include the Tax date field.
  • Make use of a Custom Field & Logic enhancement to store the Tax Date during your posting.
  • In regard to legal reporting, ensure to check if your DRC reports already show the applicable rate.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: In SAP Public Cloud, there is an issue in sales order...
entry.content:
Hello @Amit66 

There is no standard switch to prevent users from entering the same manual item condition ZPR1 multiple times, which causes the pricing to be summed up.

To enforce only once per item, either to avoid a manual base price and set ZPR1 to automatic in Manage Prices Sales or add a BAdI check to reject a second ZPR1 item.

Helpful SAP Documentation

SAP Help , Pricing and Conditions: behaviour of conditions in pricing. SAP Help Portal-Pricing and Conditions

KBA 2756560 , Cloud BAdIs for pricing include the Public-Cloud pricing BAdIs that help you enforce the single-entry rule by checking and overriding item conditions. This ensures smooth and consistent pricing management. 2756560 - Cloud BAdIs for pricing

Let me know if you need more support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Maintenance Order Not Showing in Capacity Scheduling...
entry.content:
Good day @MohamedKharbouch 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Maintenance Scheduling Board, Capacity Scheduling Board & Capacity Requirement

This is one of the most discussed integration topics between plant maintenance and production planning in public cloud. Fact is, both are handled by separate capacity evaluation applications and distinct capacity categories.

To answer you question:

Answer to Question 1: No, it should not. Maintenance order will appear in the Maintenance Schedule Board.

Answer to Question 2: eliminated by answer 1.

Answer to Question 3: Yes, the functionality is not available in public cloud.

The summary is, in public cloud, the maintenance orders do not appear in the production Capacity Scheduling Board. Even if both share the same work center, PM uses a different capacity category, and PP boards evaluate only the production capacities.

Integration with the production load is not available in public cloud. This you will only find in on-prem/private cloud.

If you want to coordinate maintenance and production downtime, make sure to use the Maintenance Scheduling Board or shift-availability planning in PP.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Pack stock (not received) in to HU for Inbound Delivery
entry.content:
Hello @kdv3 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Operations for Handling Unit API & Pack Outbound Deliveries for more details.

In summary, you cannot pack inbound delivery items into handling units through API before good receipt. The handling Unit API requires StockItemUUID, which only exists after good receipt. However, you can consider the following options to enable you carry out the intended action:

  • Make use of Pack Inbound Deliveries manually before GR
  • Or post GR first, then call the API_HANDLING_UNIT_2 with StockItemUUID.

Please note that reference-based HU creation works only for outbound deliveries.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Unable to exclude BankDetails segment from Business P...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the Bank Details (BUT0BK) segment of the Business Partner SOAP message SAP_COM_0008 BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest) cannot be excluded through standard DRF filtering.

What options are available to you (safe choices)

Intercept BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest and strip the <BankDetails> node before forwarding to EWM to prevent IBAN/BIC from leaving S/4HANA Public cloud.

Avoid storing bank data on suppliers frequently replicated to EWM, as it's often unfeasible in finance scenarios.

Check below KBA

KBA 3012682 ‚Äî Business Partner Segment Filter is not considered in S/4HANA Public Cloud; segment filters apply at object level, but do not remove entire BP unless filtered. SAP Support Portal-KBA 3012682 - Business Partner Segment Filter not Considered in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

KBA 3245240 ‚Äî Filters for Business Partner (SAP_COM_0008) SOAP Replication do not take effect, documenting filtering behaviour and limitations for SAP_COM_0008. SAP Support Portal-3245240 - Filters for Business Partner (SAP_COM_0008) SOAP Replication Not Taking Effect

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Clarification on ‚ÄúManage Memo Record 2.0‚Äù and Bank Ac...
entry.content:
Hello @hyik 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Manage Memo Records 2.0 for more insights.

In summary, the behaviour you are experiencing when you use Manage Memo Record 2.0, the uploaded amount appears in Cash Flow Analyser but not as the opening balance in your first bank statement is a standard behaviour in public cloud.

Memo records are meant for liquidity forecasting and not for bank reconciliation. The Bank Statement app reads your opening balances only from the statement file or manual entry but not from memo data.

Best practice is to use Manage Memo Records 2.0 for your liquidity planning.

You should include your opening balance directly in the first bank statement upload for reconciliation.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error message F110 : payment not possible because of...
entry.content: Hello @Chuma, thanks for your reply... well I am not on public cloud, I use SAP GUI and private cloud. entry.title: Re: /SAPAPO/CURTO 851: product does not exist
entry.content:
/SAPAPO/CURTO 851: product does not exist

Resolution: Look into SAP note 3552200 - Error in PDS transfer via tx CURTOADV_CREATE - Product xy does not exist in SAP S/4HANA ( /SAPAPO/CURTO 851 )

SM59 - Change the RFC settings for Transfer protocol  from "Fast" to "Classic" in Serializer field.

PDS will be transferred successfully into APO

entry.title: Issue with IDoc File Line Endings (LF vs. CRLF) After S/4HANA Migration
entry.content:
We are interfacing with an external system using IDoc files.

After our migration to S/4HANA, the newline character in the output files has changed to LF (Line Feed), which has caused the external system to be unable to recognize and process them.

The entire process, from IDoc transmission to file output, is handled using standard SAP functionality; we are not using any custom programs for this.

Since modifying the external system to accept LF is not an option, we need to find a way to convert the output to CRLF within our SAP system.

Could you please advise on the best method to achieve this?

entry.title: Re: Offboarding custom task completion email notification
entry.content: Hi Gopinath, I have resolved the issue. The solution to this is to follow the steps at the section "Trigger Home Page Card for Custom Task" in the same blogpost, but add the email receiver in the "CC" section of the workflow as well so that both Homepage Card alert and receive the email alert at the same time.
